thread.title: Australian airfares dip as nation's currency weakens: Kayak
thread.title_full: Australian airfares dip as nation's currency weakens: Kayak

author: Singapore, September 28, 2015
title: Australian airfares dip as nation's currency weakens: Kayak
text: Australian airfares dip as nation's currency weakens: Kayak Singapore, September 28, 2015 ACCORDING to data from Kayak.sg, there has been a 20 per cent rise in flight searches to Australia and average flight prices to the country has fallen by 18 per cent in August, due to the devaluation of the Aussie dollar in the previous months. Compared to the same period last year, flight searches from Singapore to Australia increased by an average of 20 per cent in 3Q2015 with a rally of 32 per cent in June, 23 per cent in July and 10 per cent in August. Other than saving on a better deal for goods and services in Australia, travellers also save on airfare. Based on flight prices found on Kayak.sg, airfares to Australia has dipped 18 per cent on average in August (S$610) compared to the previous month (S$744). Debbie Soo, vice president, APAC at Kayak.sg, said: â€œThe tumbling Aussie dollar offers the perfect opportunity for travellers to experience Australia at a better price point than usual."
